results.title: Searching
results.brief_description: After David Kim’s 16-year-old daughter goes missing, a local investigation is opened and a detective is assigned to the case. But 37 hours later and without a single lead, David decides to search the one place no one has looked yet, where all secrets are kept today: his daughter’s laptop.

constellations_other.name: Screen story searching
constellations_other.description: Cinema, smartphones and sensuality collide in this intriguing Constellation that takes a distinctly different path.

constellations_other.name: Home movies, fiction and reality blurred
constellations_other.description: The accessibility and portability of cameras has had a big impact on how we see ourselves and the world. As camera technology continues to evolve, so do our ways of seeing, with the line between reality and fiction disappearing.

results.title: Search goes full circle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Search”.
This episode of the British television series “Search” looks at recycling waste materials in order to be more environmentally aware. Shows how to compost, make recyled paper and discusses the recycling of items such as cans, and second hand clothing which is made into a felt-like material and used as filling

results.title: Search for the super
results.creator_credit: Anne Batty, Peter Batty and Peter Batty Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Visions of War”.
This is the fascinating background story to the making and testing of the first H-Bomb. It contains much fine colour archive film as well as contributions from many of the principal participants in the hydrogen-bomb saga. The story continues on from the first atomic bomb drops on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945, through to the bomb test at Bikini Atoll in 1954.

results.title: Search for the shark callers
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Maynard and Grainger Maynard
results.brief_description: A description of a two month trek by kayak through the Solomon Islands, showing the people and their culture, wildlife and tourist attractions. Experience the dying art of summon sharks with a native priest, visit steaming volcanoes and take part in pagan dances and other local ceremonies!

results.title: Search for the great apes
results.brief_description: Narrated by Richard Kiley. Deep within the rainforest of Indonesia and Central Africa, two women scientists patiently study the habits of two species of apes - Birute Galdikas-Brindamour and her husband spend their time with the orang-outang in Borneo and Dian Fossey (the inspiration for the Hollywood film, “Gorillas in the mist”) studies the mountain gorilla of Rwanda.

results.title: Search for the Battleship Bismarck
results.creator_credit: Peter Schnall, Christine Weber and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: National Geographic looks back at the first - and last- mission of the Bismarck, sunk on May 27, 1941 with a loss of more than 2,000 lives. Narrated by Richard Kiley, they talk with survivors of the notorious World War II battle, and reveals exclusive footage of the remarkable exploration for the sunken ship 600 miles off the coast of France.

results.title: Search for security
results.creator_credit: Adrian Boddington, Jennie Blackwood, Victoria. Hospitals and Charities Commission and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: A presentation of the problems facing the aged and the community’s responsibility to them. Shows through the experiences of one elderly lady (played by Lorna Forbes) the services rendered by social workers, district nurses, and “meals on wheels”. Emphasises need for companionship, warmth and comfort, as well as a degree of independence.

results.title: Search for oil
results.brief_description: ‘Search for oil’ explains some of the work involved in oil exploration prior to drilling wells. The technology is becoming increasingly complex as the search becomes more difficult, but the story is told in a simple way using interesting images from around the world with basic non-technical animated drawings. It incorporates examples of the latest advances in the field of seismic exploration.

results.title: Search for identity
results.brief_description: Presents the history of a former Cobb and Co coach house on the Old Sydney Road at Avenel in Central Victoria, from its early days in the 1850s to the present. Explores methods of research showing various techniques used to reconstruct the building’s history: visits to the Central Plans Office, Titles Office and Avenel Cemetery; and an examination of the building’s structure. Narrated bhy John Stanton.
